Dear Timothy Nelson:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Jessica VandenHeuvel at 616-204-6992.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Employment policies and procedures; establishment
Title
Rule Code & COF Rule 400.10107
Section A facility shall establish and follow written employment policies and
Description procedures that shall assure that staff are emotionally stable and
suitable health, ability, experience, and education to perform the
duties assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On or around 5/6/24, youths’ beds were out of their bedrooms as
punishments. One youth attempted to grab onto their bed, but a
staff pushed the youth back into their room.
Investigation Interviews:
Complaint Source was interviewed via phone on May 14, 2024.
Complaint Source did not have any additional information. He
reported he received this information due to a grievance that was
filed by Youth A.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on May 13,
2024. Youth A reported on May 6, 2024, he was frustrated with Staff
1 because Youth A did not want to participate in the pastoral
services. He reported he was told he had to go to his room because
he was swearing on the unit. Due to the consequence, he was not
allowed to have his bedding in his room until he completed his
consequence. Youth A reported when it was his time to shower, he
followed the directions but when he was in the shower, he processed
out loud that he did not want to follow through with his consequence.
He reported talking out loud about the situation is one of his coping
skills so he does not make a poor decision. Youth A reported when
he was heading back to his room, he had thought about grabbing his
bed off the floor but knew that would not be a smart idea. He
reported he tried to grab his socks that were near his bed on the
ground outside of his room and Staff 1 pushed him into his
room. Youth A reported when he was pushed, he fell to the ground
and hit his head. He reported Staff 1 had one hand on Youth A’s
chest when he pushed him into his room and closed the door. Youth
A reported he never flinched at Staff 1 and does not know why he
was pushed. He reported after he was pushed, he was upset in his
room and was yelling about the way he was treated. Youth A
reported he refused to see the nurse when he disclosed to staff what
happened because he did not feel like it was necessary. Youth A
stated he hit the front of his head on the ground. This consultant saw
no bruising on Youth A’s head. He reported there was no other staff
or youth present to see the push occur.
2

Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on May 13,
2024. Staff 1 reported on May 6, 2024, he was the only staff working
on Youth A’s unit. He reported Youth A had been struggling most of
the day and was constantly being redirected to calm down his
behaviors. Staff 1 reported Youth A engaged in negative behavior
utilizing profanity during the time pastoral care was present. Youth A
was given a five-minute time out due to the use of profanity and
constant talking. He reported Youth A refused to take that time
out which resulted in Youth A getting another consequence to go to
his room and complete a reflection. Within this consequence, all
items have to be removed from his room, including his bedding.
When it came time for showers Youth A was the last to shower.
When Youth A was in the shower, Staff 1 heard Youth A state he
was not going to follow through with his consequence and he was
going to take his bed back into his room when he was heading back.
When Youth A walked back from the shower, he got into a power
struggle with Staff 1 about wanting to do his hygiene in his
room but due to being on the consequence still, he was not allowed
to have that privilege. Staff 1 reported Youth A completed his
hygiene in the community bathroom and when Youth A was heading
back to his room, he stated to Staff 1 he was going to take his bed
back into his room. Staff 1 told Youth A he was not allowed to do that
due to the consequence he received. Youth A bent down to grab his
bed, and Staff 1 put his foot on the bed to stop Youth
A from grabbing it. Staff 1 reported when Youth A was bent
down grabbing his bedding, Youth A flinched at Staff 1, and Staff 1
responded by taking his left hand and pushing Youth A on his chest
back into his room. He reported Youth A had the intention of striking
him in the face and to protect himself he had to push Youth A away.
Staff 1 reported he closed Youth A’s door right after the push, as
Youth A was continuing to attempt to come at him. Staff 1 reported
he called Supervisor over for support right after the incident occurred.
He reported when he pushed Youth A it was with an open palm on
his chest and there were no intentions to harm Youth A. Staff 1
reported he has been trained in Handle with Care, which is a restraint
model staff have been trained in. He reported he is aware there is no
approved technique to push a youth but, in this situation, he had no
other way to protect himself. When asked what could have been
done differently, Staff 1 discussed how he could have called
Supervisor over for support before Youth A went into the shower, as
Youth A had been in a power struggle with Staff 1 for most of the
shift.
Supervisor was interviewed face to face at the facility on May
13, 2024. Supervisor reported she responded to a call from Staff 1 on
May 6, 2024, due to concerns about Youth A’s behavior. She
reported Youth A was already in his room when she arrived, and he
was yelling in his room about being on a consequence. Supervisor
3

reported she spoke with Staff 1 about what happened, and he
reported Youth A was trying to charge at him so in self-defense he
pushed Youth A back into his room. She reported staff should
not push a youth and if Youth A was attempting to charge at him then
he should have used blocking techniques. She reported she has no
concerns with Staff 1's interaction with the youth and noted he is
structured with the youth and programming.
Chief Administrator was interviewed via phone on May 10, 2024,
and face to face at the facility on May 13, 2024. Chief
Administrator reported he had received a grievance request from
Youth A to watch video footage from May 6, 2024. He reported he
reviewed video footage and saw Staff 1 push Youth A into his room
with one hand to Youth A’s chest. Chief Administrator reported this is
against policy at the facility. Youth A reported to Chief Administrator
he hit his head when Staff 1 pushed him. Youth A was offered to see
nursing but declined. Chief Administrator reported he did not see any
marks or bruises on Youth A’s head. He reported he spoke with Staff
1 who reported he pushed Youth A back because he was lunging at
him.
Probation Officer was interviewed via phone on May 13, 2024.
Probation Officer reported the facility sent him the incident report of
these allegations. He stated he has no concerns of Youth A’s care
within the facility. Probation Officer reported Youth A has not been
physically assaultive with staff or peers at the facility but has been
known to get a bit “mouthy” with staff and try to show off in front of
peers.
Video Reviewed:
Video footage of May 6, 2024, in the hallway outside Youth A’s
bedroom was reviewed on May 13, 2024. Youth A walked out from
the left side of the video and Staff 1 was sitting at the table in front of
Youth A’s bedroom door. There is a mattress laying to the left side of
the front of Youth A’s bedroom door. As Youth A walked near the
bedding, Staff 1 got up from the table and walked behind Youth A.
When Youth A was near the bedroom door, he had his hand on the
door to open and maintained looking down while Staff 1 stood behind
him. As the door opened, Youth A bent down towards the bedding
but never put his hand on the bedding before Staff 1 took his left
hand to Youth A’s chest and pushed Youth A into the room while
Staff 1’s right hand maintained holding the bedroom door. Within the
video it cannot be seen if Youth A fell but within one second Youth A
is at the door while Staff 1 still had part of the door open and stood in
the doorway. Staff 1 closed the door and walked away briefly, turned
around and shut the shutter part of the door. The video ended with
Staff 1 sitting at the table in front of Youth A’s room. The incident is
40 seconds in total.
4

Documents Reviewed:
- Youth A’s Grievance dated May 8, 2024- Youth A asked for
administration to review the camera footage from May 6,
2024, but did not give a reason of why. On May 10, 2024,
Administrator reviewed the video footage and noted concerns.
- Facility Policy- Discipline, Use of Physical Force,
Managing Behavior Control System- This policy notes
physical force should not be used as a punishment and
corporal punishment is prohibited. Physical force is limited to
those techniques from the Handle with Care Behavior
Management Systems Model guidelines. Within those
guidelines it does not indicate a staff member can push a
youth.
- Handle with Care Procedures- Documentation was reviewed
that staff are trained on within the facility to help with de-
escalation of a youth. There is no approved technique that
allows a staff to push a youth.
- Staff 1’s Personnel File- There was no disciplinary record
and Staff 1 completed the required Handle with Care training
on August 9, 2023, and refresher training on August 30, 2023.
Staff 1 completed de-escalation and customer service training
on March 12, 2024.
- Incident Report date May 6, 2024- Incident report was
reviewed and was consistent with Staff 1’s interview.
Analysis The facility is found in non-compliance as per video review, Youth
A and Staff 1’s interview, Staff 1 pushed Youth A into his room.
There was no evidence shown in the video of Youth A attempting
to assault Staff 1.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.

sir_summary.summary: A staff member at the Kent County Juvenile Detention Center pushed a youth into his room, causing him to fall and hit his head, after a disagreement over a consequence involving the removal of his bedding. The investigation, including video review, substantiated the push but found no evidence the youth was assaulting the staff, violating policies prohibiting physical punishment and force outside approved techniques. This is a repeat violation, indicating a failure to ensure staff suitability and compliance with behavior management protocols; primary culpability lies with the staff member for the improper use of force and with facility management for failing to prevent recurring violations.
